item.title: HOME
item.description: I am a Ph.D. Student in Public Administration at the Department of Public Policy, Management and Analytics at the University of Illinois Chicago (UIC). I am an affiliated student of the Networks and Governance Lab at UIC.Hi! My name is Jahun Lee, and I am an Ph.D. Student in the Department of Public Policy, Management, and Analytics at the University of Illinois Chicago. My research focuses on urban governance, in particular, how local governments interact with others, including other governments, private organizations, particularly nonprofits, to enhance their performance and improve outcomes for their communities. Currently, I have interests in the influence of demographic shifts on urban governance.

item.title: 2_Research
item.description: My research primarily focuses on urban governance which involves various choices of different actors. Particularly, I concentrate on collaborations between local governments and third parties to understand patterns and mechanisms in urban contexts. Why Urban shrinkage? Figure 1. Map of Research Interests and Projects Title: (TBD) - The Choice of Service Delivery Mode Title: A Study on the Reconceptualization of Sharing and a Case Analysis of the Sharing Economy (공유의 재개념화와 공유경제 사례분석: 서울시 자동차 공유사례를 중심으로) Advisor: Dr. Tae Young Kim Year: 2018 Sharing has become a rhetorical device in marketing and public policy, as it carries connotations of community. The concept of “sharing” generates confusion in public policy because it has multiple and ambiguous meanings. This study explores the concept of sharing, develops an ideal type of “sharing,” and analyzes the case of car-sharing in Seoul using this framework. Lee, M. & Lee, J. (2025). Assessment of Jeju's Regional Conditions Using the Balanced National Development Index and Policy Implications. Society for Jeju Studies. 64. 223-246. 10.47520/jjs.2025.64.223.
